tasks.task: Build cold frames under a black walnut tree to extend the growing season.
subtasks: Prepare rectangles made of boards for the cold frames.
Assemble the top sections of the cold frames using pine 2x2.
Cover the cold frames with a plastic panel substitute (Tuftex).
Add hinges to allow the cold frames to be opened partially or fully.
Apply mulch to the ground around the cold frames.

tasks.task: Create access for future herb usage.
subtasks: Plan to use the cold frames for growing herbs for cooking and smoothies.

tasks.task: Consider expanding the cold frame setup.
subtasks: Aim to have eight to ten cold frames in total.
Designate the cold frames as a personal kitchen garden.
